title: Authorizing Cameron County, Texas, To Construct, Maintain, and Operate a Pedestrian Border Crossing at the Gateway International Bridge Land Port of Entry
summary: The document is a presidential permit issued on August 20, 2025, authorizing Cameron County, Texas, to construct, maintain, and operate a pedestrian crossing at the Gateway International Bridge Land Port of Entry on the U.S.-Mexico border. The permit outlines conditions for construction, maintenance, and operation, including compliance with federal, state, and local laws, environmental impact mitigation, and inspection rights for relevant agencies. Key points include the requirement for Cameron County to obtain necessary permits, notify the President of any transfers of control, and ensure the facilities are maintained in good condition. The permit also specifies that it is valid for five years from the date of issuance and can be terminated or amended by the President at any time. The permit does not create any enforceable rights against the United States or its agencies.
